TopicTitle: "Ok, I think we should go to full burn now--" - "No! Jeb! Nooooo!"

Articles.Content:
Well, what can I say.

I\'m just an old geezer who recently discovered KSP.

Allow me to tell you all I\'m as pleased with the game as I am with the humour generally displayed in this forum.

So far I\'ve placed a few Probodobodyne satellites in orbit around Kerbin with the help of a few mod parts, and I believe that today I have completed what will be a double-mission rocket once the next update is released. I shall then be able to get into orbit around Kerbin, drop a small satellite there and then journey on to the MÃ¼n and back. Well, the 'back' part will probably need some fine tuning, but I\'ll see about that once we\'ve landed on the MÃ¼n.

It sounds more complex than it actually is though. The kind of rockets that some of you people here build really blow my mind.

Tl;dr:

Glad to be here, slowly getting the hang of the game, looking forward to the MÃ¼n update.

And remember, Gentlemen, you can never have enough boosters.

We need more boosters.

Welcome to the forums btw, \'hope you enjoy your stay here.

Welcome to the KSP Forums!

Happy Launching!

Arrr!

Capt\'n Skunky

Full burn in atmo?

Won\'t that cause a blowback? Burn us out?

We need more boosters.

Welcome to the forums btw, \'hope you enjoy your stay here.

You make it sound like a hotel or cruise.

You make it sound like a hotel or cruise.

Indeed, it suggests that he might leave.

I very much disapprove of that and say welcome, you will never leave.

Well, I am indeed prone to lose interest in most stuff sooner or later, so that might be the case with KSP too one day.

In that sense, he chose the right words.

For now, I\'m having boatloads of fun with the game, and I can\'t wait to go to the mÃ¼n once it is released. And maybe that will keep me hooked for long enough to see the release of other planets...
